lexUnit.name: coat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: provide with or form a layer or covering

sentence.text: The particles are coated with a single molecular layer of a dye ( a not particularly cheap complex of ruthenium -- but since so little is used , it hardly adds to the expense ) .
No doubt the roofs of the more prestigious buildings were coated with layers of cement .

Virions were pelleted by centrifugation at 40,000 rpm for 1 hr , resuspended in 100Âµl 2% phosphotungstic acid and dropped onto Formvar-coated grids which had previously been coated with a thin layer of carbon .
Finally , coat with a fine film of cooking oil before storing for long periods .
Then he 'd shown her , over her mother 's objections , how to take the gun apart , clean it , then coat each part with a thin oil before reassembling it .
After he 'd coated the segments in salt and chilli he passed them round , and everyone smacked their lips and screwed up their faces in pained delight .
It would also be advisable to coat the bogwood with a clear , polyurethane varnish .
Coat each hair with a fine translucent film which smooths down the rough surface & seals the hair to prevent moisture loss .
You will certainly need to experiment with exposure periods if you are coating your own boards with a UV sensitive aerosol lacquer .
Lightly coat your hands with one or two drops and smooth over your hair , before or after styling .
Coat the edges of the crack with neat pva building adhesive .
Coat the end of the wood with quick-set glue .
Some diets are coated by the manufacturer to prevent the pellets sticking together during autoclaving .
Some of the stone vases were partially coated with gold leaf .
The back of the rug is then coated with latex and is normally covered by a piece of cloth .
Each pellet of ammonium nitrate was coated with a hydrocarbon wax to reduce the effects of hygroscopicity .
Leaves coated with a strain of engineered bacterium from which the offending gene has been eliminated do not suffer from the formation of ice .
